page.title: 12Alfriston Village
page.content:
Alfriston is a small,pretty village. It is well known for its connections with smuggling and many of the houses are said to have secret tunnels.
In the middle of the village there is a huge chestnut tree and the stump of a medieval market cross.
There are many shops in Alfriston catering for the vast numbers of tourists which visit each year. There are antique shops,tea shops and an art gallery. Many of the buildings along the High Street are timber framed including the Smugglers Inn and the Star Inn,which dates back to the 15th Century.
Behind the High Street is the Parish Church and the River Cuckmere.
